intro: Oldenlandia lancea, commonly known as the slender oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with slender, branching stems. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
